content:
Action:1

I'm choosing to move left, which should advance the avatar from (7,6) to the open floor at (7,5) and help orient us in the direction of the exit at (1,1).

Action:4

I'm moving the avatar upward from (7,5) to (6,5) to begin approaching the exit at (1,1), expecting a successful step since row6, col5 is open floor.

Action:4

I'm moving UP from my current position; if the chain pushing works as expected, the box in (5,5) will be nudged upward (and in turn push the box in (4,5) into (3,5)), which clears the way for further progress toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:3

I'm moving the avatar down from (6,5) to (7,5) since it's a clear floor tile, setting up a potential path toward the exit at (1,1) by avoiding the adjacent boxes.

Action:4

I'm moving UP from (7,5) to (6,5) to start heading towards the exit at (1,1), and I expect this will bring the avatar closer to our goal while avoiding immediate obstacles.

Action:1

I'm moving left, which should push the box from (6,4) into the free space at (6,3) and allow my avatar to advance towards a route that eventually leads to the exit at (1,1).

Action:4

I'm moving upward, which will push the box from (5,4) into the free floor at (4,4), helping me progress in the direction of the exit.

Action:1

I'm moving left so that my avatar advances toward the exit while avoiding pushing any boxes prematurely.

Action:2
I'm moving right into the open floor at (5,4) to start heading around obstacles and eventually work towards the exit at (1,1).

Action:4

I'm moving UP to push the box chain upward, which should clear space and bring me closer to the exit at (1,1), assuming the chain push successfully relocates the boxes out of my way.

Action:1

I'm moving the avatar left from (5,4) to (5,3) to head toward the exit at (1,1) while avoiding the box directly above.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,3) to (5,4) to access free space and eventually work my way upward toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:1

I move left to clear the way toward the exit, expecting the avatar to shift from (5,4) to (5,3) and open up further upward paths.

Action:2  
I'm moving right from (5,3) to (5,4) to start navigating around the immediate hazards, expecting that this step brings me closer to the exit while avoiding the hole above.

Action:1

I'm moving left from row 5, col 4 to row 5, col 3, advancing toward the exit at row 1, col 1 while avoiding hazards; I expect the avatar to actually move into an open floor space.

Action:2

I'm moving the avatar to the right from (5,3) to (5,4) since left is blocked by a wall and up is dangerous (a hole), expecting this safe step to open up more viable paths toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:4

I'm choosing to move upward, which should trigger a chain push of the box from (4,4) into (3,4) and then into (2,4), clearing the way for my avatar to continue its journey toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:1

I'm moving left from (5,4) to (5,3) to start heading toward the exit at (1,1); I expect the avatar will successfully move into the clear floor space.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,3) to (5,4), since that cell is safe and it opens up potential paths upward and left toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:4

I'm pushing upward to move into the box at (4,4), expecting the chain push to shift the boxes (with the box at (4,4) moving into (3,4) and that at (3,4) moving into (2,4)), so that I can progress upward toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:2

I'm choosing to push right, expecting that the avatar will advance into (5,5) by nudging the box from (5,5) into (5,6) and thereby starting to clear a path toward the exit.

Action:1

I decided to move left in hopes of beginning a clear path toward the exit at (1,1), expecting my avatar to shift from (5,5) to (5,4).

Action:1

I'm moving left from (5,4) to (5,3); this safe step takes me closer to the exit at (1,1) without interacting with any hazardous or undo-triggering obstacles.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,3) to (5,4), which is an open floor space, so I can later plan an upward route toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:4

I'm moving UP to trigger the chain push of the box at (4,4) into (3,4) and then into (2,4), expecting this to open a path upward toward the exit.

Action:1

I'm moving left from (5,4) to (5,3) on an empty floor tile, gradually heading towards the exit at (1,1) as part of my planned upward/leftward path.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,3) to (5,4) onto a safe floor, expecting the avatar to advance along a path that could lead upward toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,4) to (5,5) so that I can later push the box at (4,5) upward into an open space, which sets me on a path toward the exit.

Action:4

I'm moving UP to push the box from (4,5) towards (3,5) and step into (4,5), gradually clearing a path toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:1

I'm moving left to push the box at (4,4) into the hole at (4,3), which should clear a path toward the exit at (1,1) while avoiding hazards.

Action:4

I'm pushing upward from the avatar’s current position (4,4) to move the box at (3,4) into (2,4), clearing a potential path toward the exit. I expect the avatar to advance upward into (3,4) as planned, setting up subsequent moves to reach the exit.

Action:1

I've decided to move left, expecting that my avatar will push the box from (3,3) into (3,2), clearing a path toward the exit at (1,1).

Action:1

I'm pushing left so the avatar can nudge the box at (3,2) into (3,1), which should clear the direct path toward moving upward in the direction of the exit at (1,1).

```Action:4```
I'm moving upward from (3,2) to (2,2) as it sets me on the direct path toward the exit at (1,1), and I expect the avatar to successfully advance one cell upward.

Action:1

I'm moving left from (2,2) to (2,1) to start progressing toward the exit at (1,1), expecting the avatar's position to update accordingly.

Action:4

I am moving the avatar upward from (2,1) towards the exit at (1,1), expecting that stepping on it will trigger the win condition.
